entry.title: ABAP Trial 2023 - Licence issues and Permanent Compiling issues
entry.content:
Dear all,

I installed SAP ABAP Trial 2023 in the last week. In the past I had already installed 1909 or one release higher. In the past, the application started comparatively quickly. Now - on the same environment - it requires three times the time. Anybody experiencing the same behaviour with 2023 compared to the former 2 releases?

More importantly and much more annoying are the following issues:

1. Licence issue:
When I had installed the trial in docker, and started the system, I wanted to login using the user developer and the initial password. This was not possible. The system message was "Logon not possible (Error in license check)

Obviously the license is already expired after the installation. No issue - in the installation description there is a good explanation how to renew the license. Having done this, it worked with the user developer. I could login. But... here is the issue:

Every time after a restart of the application the same issue comes up. And after every restart of the docker, the same procedure to renew the license has to be done compeletely, because the hardware key seems to change every time. And I have now clue why. It seems to be not sufficient to store the hardware key somewhere in a document and to quickly renew the license and reinstall the license file. No, you first need to login with the user SAP*, check the hardware key, which changes every time and then to renew the license file and reinstall that. Doing this every time after a restart is so annoyoing that I have concerns whehter this system is really usable for me.

Does anybody experienced the same issue? I have not experienced this behaviour using one of the former ABAP Trial releases. My first idea was: Well, I just keep the system up and running. But this also does not work either. When I don¬¥t use the system, e.g. because I go to bed, the next day the system is not running any more. Obviously the container stops to work after some idle time. So I do need to restart the system whenever I want to use it and then the license issues comes up. Any idea how to solve this?

2. Issue Permanent compiling starting any transaction

Once I solved the license issue, I can login, but then the next issue comes up, which I also never experienced in the former releases. The system is compiling for every transaction. Every experience SAP guy will now say: Use transaction SGEN and compile one time and you have fixed it. I did so, no resolution.

These 2 issues are really annoying and make it impossible for me to work with the system. Does anybody know a solution for these two really nasty issues?


Thanks in advance for any help.


Best regards,

Joachim

P.S: As @JuliePlummer mentioned or asked for in different places, I tried to add or to choose the hashtag #ABAP_Trial here in SAP Managed Tags. There was no such has tag unfortunately...

entry.title: Re: Error message: FINOC165 and FINOC297 - Manage Cost Ce...
entry.content:
Please note that you cannot change the Profit Center in S/4HANA because, the profit center is part of the time‚Äëdependent master data of a cost center. Once there are actual postings (even if reversed), the system protects the historical link between cost center and profit center to avoid inconsistencies in reporting and reconciliation (especially in Universal Journal ACDOCA and Asset Accounting). Reversing a posting doesn‚Äôt remove the original line from the database ‚Äî it just adds an offsetting entry ‚Äî so the system still sees ‚Äúpostings exist‚Äù for that validity period.

The SAP notes what you tried 3477968, 3514994, 3567063 are part of SAP‚Äôs delivery of the Profit Center Reorganization functionality and related message control. They introduce new message numbers (like 297, 165) that can be set to warning in OBA5 to allow changes under certain conditions. In FPS01, those message numbers weren‚Äôt yet delivered and they appear only from FPS02 onwards, which is why you can‚Äôt find them in OBA5 in your system.

Since the message control entries aren‚Äôt in your release, you have three main paths:

Option A ‚Äì Use Profit Center Reorganization
This is the supported way to change profit center assignments for master data with historical postings.

  • In On‚ÄëPremise, you can activate and run the Profit Center Reorganization process (transaction FAGL_REORG* family).
  • It creates transfer postings in the Universal Journal to move balances from the old profit center to the new one as of a key date.

Option B ‚Äì Create a new cost center

  • If reorg is too heavy for your case, create a new cost center with the correct profit center and change assignments in dependent objects (e.g., work centers, internal orders, assets).
  • Close the old cost center for postings.

Option C ‚Äì Upgrade to FPS02 or apply targeted SAP Notes

  • FPS02 delivers the message control for 297 and 165, allowing you to set them to warning in OBA5.
  • If you can‚Äôt upgrade, check with SAP Support if they can provide a down‚Äëported correction for FPS01 to deliver those message numbers.

entry.title: ABAP AI Revolution Accelerates: The ABAP Developer Who Built Enterprise Apps in Minutes
entry.content:
The ABAP AI revolution just got a massive functionality upgrade and stays FREE OF CHARGE for another year

Remember John, our seasoned ABAP developer who discovered the power of Joule for AI-assisted coding? His journey has taken an incredible turn. What started as relief from "quick questions" and real-time assistance has evolved into something he never imagined possible ‚Äì building entire applications and transforming legacy systems through conversation in minutes. 

John's incredible journey is about to accelerate even further with game-changing news: Joule for Developers remains FREE OF CHARGE for another year ‚Äì the promotion has been extended with no commercial barriers, allowing every customer and partner to benefit from AI-driven development through material numbers 8019124 (customers) and 8019541 (TDD partners). This offer is now available not only for the BTP ABAP environments (Steampunk) and SAP Cloud ERP Public, but also to our SAP Cloud ERP Private customers using the latest 2025 release version. For a deep dive in more commercial details see ABAP AI - Chapter 2 blog written by my colleague @AlexanderRother 

See John's ABAP AI complete evolution with 2505, 2508 and 2025 ABAP releases:

  • The Game-Changer: ABAP Cloud Application Generation
  • Intelligent Business Logic with RAP Business Logic Prediction
  • Seamless Integration with OData Consumption
  • Enhanced Extensibility with Extensibility AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Public
  • The Migration Revolution: Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

 

The Game-Changer: ABAP Cloud Application Generation

John's latest project required a library application with multiple entities. Opening his package in ADT, he right-clicks and selects "Generate ABAP Repository Objects." The new OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard with Joule Chat appears.

"Create a library application with entities for branches, book stock, users and borrowing information. Generate the appropriate fields which fit the business case for the entities." John prompts.

Within seconds, Joule responds with a comprehensive proposal including all entities, fields, and relationships. One click on "Accept" and the wizard auto-populates all configuration fields. Minutes later, John has a complete, runnable RAP application with data model, behavior definitions, service bindings, and OData services ready for UI consumption.

Intelligent Business Logic with RAP Business Logic Prediction

But the magic doesn't stop at application generation. John's application needs sophisticated business logic ‚Äì validations for booking dates, automatic stock calculations, and borrowing permission determinations.

Navigating to his behavior implementation class, John finds empty method stubs for his determinations and validations. The RAP Predict Business Logic capability kicks in, understanding the entity structure, field relationships, and business context to generate complete validation logic within the method implementation.

"It's not just generating code," John marvels. "It's understanding the business context and implementing proper RAP patterns automatically."

Seamless Integration with OData Consumption

When John needs to integrate with external booking services, he opens his service consumption model and starts the Joule chat with the /consume slash command. The OData consumption capability generates complete, ready-to-use ABAP code for consuming OData calls via the OData Client Proxy, tailored to his specific service model. 

What used to take hours of documentation reading now happens in seconds with Joule providing example prompts and OData request generation.

Enhanced Extensibility with Extensibility AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Public

As business requirements evolve, the Extensibility AI Assistant guides John through adding custom fields for regulatory compliance. It assists him in:

  • Creating Custom Fields for borrowing information
  • Finding Business Contexts for the right extension points
  • Enabling Usages where custom fields can be exposed in UIs, APIs, and analytical views
  • Enabling Business Scenarios for data flow between business objects
  • Finding Value Help Views for code list-based custom fields
  • Finding BAdIs based on natural language input

The Migration Revolution: Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 release, John faces his organization's biggest challenge: migrating 15 years of custom ECC code to SAP ERP Cloud Private 2025. The Custom Code Migration AI Assistant will transforms this experience (on October 2025 planned release).  These use cases are currently not available on the older releases, however the use cases delivered on 2025 versions will be soon provided also as part of the Custom Code Migration Application which is a standalone BTP ABAP environment (Steampunk) application which can connect freely to any ERP OnPrem or Cloud system to support RISE migrations. 

  • Using the Explain Capability: "Explain this legacy report," John types, selecting a 500-line ABAP program. The Explain capability provides detailed explanations of the ABAP program, breaking down complex concepts with support for ABAP classes, ABAP programs, and CDS artifacts. 
  • Explain ATC Findings Capability: When running ATC checks with S/4HANA readiness variants, John uses the Explain ATC Findings capability on his S/4HANA readiness findings. This capability provides detailed explanations and step by step resolution proposal on ATC findings from check variants for SAP S/4HANA Readiness, specifically for: S/4HANA: Field Length Extensions, S/4HANA: Search for Database Operations and S/4HANA: Search for Usages and Simplified Objects. Each finding links to simplification items, which Joule explains in detail.
  • Documentation Migration Assistance: Using the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant, John opens the Joule chat view,  type in /docs to start chatting about simplification items related to Custom Code Migration and ABAP SAP Help documentation.  To chat with the assistant about SAP S/4HANA simplification items and Custom Code Migration, just start asking topic-related questions. 
  • With Code proposal for code adaptation coming in SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS01, John will soon receive in addition of the step-by-step description of how to solve the ATC findings provided currently by ATC Explain functionality and a custom code adaptation automatically. 

The Complete ABAP Lifecycle Revolution

John's journey now encompasses the entire ABAP development and transformation lifecycle:

  • Build new cloud applications with OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard
  • Implement intelligent business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic
  • Integrate seamlessly with OData consumption
  • Extend dynamically with Extensibility AI Assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Public
  • Transform existing solutions with Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for RISE in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

John tells now to everyone: "Six months ago, I was struggling with syntax," John explains to his manager. "Today, I'm generating complete applications with the OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard, implementing business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic, consuming services with OData consumption, extending solutions with the Extensibility AI Assistant, and leading our S/4HANA migration with the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant ‚Äì all through natural language conversations."

The impact is transformative:

  • Application Development: Dramatically faster with ABAP Cloud Application Generation
  • Business Logic Implementation: Massive reduction in development time
  • Migration Analysis: From weeks to hours using Custom Code Migration AI Assistant
  • OData Integration: Significantly less code required for side-by-side extension scenarios

 

The AI Revolution Accelerates ‚Äì Chapter 2 Awaits! John's incredible transformation is just the beginning as we enter the next phase of ABAP AI evolution. Even more exciting, SAP is pioneering a revolutionary side-by-side ABAP AI service that will bring full AI capabilities to older SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition releases, enabling immediate access to new AI innovations without waiting for upgrades or support packages across hybrid landscapes. Get ready for TechEd 2025 where all the groundbreaking details of this hybrid AI service will be unveiled ‚Äì the future of ABAP development is about to get even more transformative!

Ready to evolve your ABAP development approach? Check out the hands-on documentation in SAP Help and join the growing community redefining what's possible in enterprise development.

entry.title: Re: CRforVS stuck forever on 13.0.26? (type initializer f...
entry.content:
Hi Andre,

Good find... Beware that 4.5 framework is no longer supported, 4.7 or 4.8 only now due to Microsoft deprecating 4.5. Check the Platform's PDF for details.

Check your App properties and be sure you are specifying 4.7 or 4.8 framework and don't use AnyCPU, specify x64, much safer to do this.

That is why the main BOE products stopped using MSIExec it install the products, Microsoft just never "cleaned" up using the uninstall function. BOE uses a MSI file per dll, sort of, the same thing Microsoft does. Years ago someone in Support created a batch file to uninstall COM dll's, before .NET. To uninstall .NET assemblies you need to use the GACUtil app and manually remove them if you really want them gone.

Also note that file belongs to Apache and is used for debugging .NET applications, I believe it's a requirement of Visual Studio .net Applications, but like you I'm not sure of the details as to why:

I see both are x86 versions, CR may be thunking to x64 platform. I'll check with DEV if there is a 64 bit version.

SO I'm not sure why the X64 MSI package didn't install the log4net file, but like you suggested something in your project may be redirecting it to an unknown location. You can use ORCA to browse the MSI's.

I don't have a PC I can test the MSI installer on but it should be here:

C:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\Crystal Reports for .NET Framework 4.0\Common\SAP BusinessObjects Enterprise XI 4.0\win64_x64\dotnet\iPoint

To sum up:

Log4net is an Apache dll for logging various parts in Visual Studio, not sure but I think it's legacy part of CR for VS or could  be a dependency in Visual Studio .NET projects... Like a lot of 3rd party dependencies SAP includes them due to version specific hooks.

Set your project to 4.7 or 4.8 Framework

Check your applications Project file, it sometimes has redirects pointing to various locations and versions, I was hooked into this one time after upgrading my project after upgrading my may test app, VS didn't update the file completely. Drove me nuts why it wouldn't build or run...

I always suggest when installing CR for VS on your Development PC to always install the 32 bit, won't be a problem end of this year due to SAP no longer building x86 runtime. You will be able to set your project to x86 mode but CR will use the x64 runtime.

Thanks again and have a great day

Don

entry.title: Easier Integration of SAP CIS with BDC (SAC, DSP, BDCC) with a new Identity Provider Administration
entry.content:
Overview

SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS) are a group of services which enable you to integrate identity and access management between systems. The goal is to provide a seamless single sign-on experience across systems while ensuring that system and data access are secure.

CIS provides several out-of-the-box features that your BDC Components and Non-BDC SAC/Datasphere do not have. 

The new IDP Admin tool will be turned on sometime in Q3. We will have a phased deployment strategy on different landscapes.

 

Why should we integrate with IAS?

Integration with SAP CIS will solve many of the identity challenges facing BDC and Non-BDC tenants. Over the years, we've had a number of influence requests asking for features related to identity in SAC and Datasphere. With a deeper integration with CIS, we can tackle many of those influence requests.

Here are just some of the benefits you will receive with integration with CIS: 

  • Ability to bypass SSO
  • Moves the Groups=sac requirement onto IAS, instead of your corporate IDP
  • Supports multiple corporate Identity Providers
  • Single IAS can be used for SuccessFactors and then BDC
  • Improved Monitoring and Auditing
  • Improved Security in which you can use SAML or OpenID Connect
  • Future proofing as most enhancements to authentication will be made to IAS

To make it easier to "bundle" with CIS, we have updated our Identity Provisioning Administration Tool (IDP-Admin). 

In this blog, I'll show you how to do this step by step

Getting Started

  • Persona: Administrator - You are the System Owner of tenant (SAC, DSP or BDCC)
  • Terminology: When referring to BDC Components or BDC, we are referring to SAP Analytics Cloud, Datasphere and Databricks. Although our example is coming out of SAP Analytics Cloud.  
  • The bundling tool is also available for Non-BDC SAC and Datasphere. In general, you may see this grouped in with BDC as the workflows are the same. 

How to do it?

In the below example, I'll cover the most common scenario our customers are dealing with. Your SAC or Datasphere is currently configured with your Corporate IDP directly.  

CIS Integration with your Corporate Identity Provider

In tenants where you are already using your corporate IDP with SAC/DSP/BDCC or you intend on using your corporate IDP, follow these steps. 

 

  1. Go to System > Administration > Security and scroll down to click on Launch Identity Provider Administration Tool
  2. Logon to Identity Provider Administration Tool (IDP Admin) using the System Owner user. If you don't have an account, click Register to create a new account. 
  3. Once logged in, you will see a tile representing the BDC Component (either SAC, DSP or BDCC).

    In our example, we have an SAC system. 

     


    From the context menu, Repair IdP will allow you to revert back to the default IDP or update the IDP metadata.


    For bundling, please select Add SAP Cloud Identity Services
    ** Note down the Tenant Type as this will be important in a few steps **

  4. The next screen will show you a list of all CIS tenants that you have deployed. You are entitled to Production and Test CIS tenants. If an IAS tenant is already used by another tenant like SuccessFactors or Ariba, this will appear on the list.  In addition, if you have purchased an IAS separately, it will also appear on this list. 



    As a best practice, it is recommended you select the IAS tenant that matches your tenant type from the Tile (in Step 3) 

    If you do not have any CIS provisioned yet, the Provision New SAP Cloud Identity Services Tenant button is enabled. This will provision a IAS which you can then bundle to.

  5. Input the System Owner details

  6. The last step is a summary of actions. 



    Click Finish
  7. CIS will be provisioned with your current tenant. This step does NOT change over the authentication source quite yet.




    Success!

    Clicking Continue will bring you to the final set up stage which is to validate and turn on authentication. In our case, since we are planning on integration our corporate IDP solution, we will click Close. 

  8. Log into CIS and go to Applications & Resources > Applications. You will see a new entry representing the BDC tenant that was just bundled.

    ** Note although the application has been created and some pre-configuration has been done, the authentication has not switched over to IAS yet. **

  9. The next step is an important step because we are going to use the same corporate IdP as before. To do this, follow these steps here: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/create-corporate-idp-in-administration-console?version=Cloud 

  10. Ensure that the Application's default authenticating Identity Provider is set to the corporate identity provider
  11. Check the Corporate Identity Providers in IAS to make sure "Use Identity Authentication user store" is enabled. This will make sure that the assertions contain the data needed by SAC/DSP/BDCC
  12. Now that you have configured your corporate IdP, it's time to finish the configuration and switch over the authentication.
    Go back to IDP Admin and then go to the Tile. 

    You can see the tile still says it is pending. Simply click on the
  13. Select an attribute type (default Email), provide the subject name identifier and select dynamic user creation if desired.



    **Note: Dynamic User creation will create new users during the logon time.
    For instance, I send a story to Sarah in SAC. Sarah has never used SAC before. She clicks on the link and she is prompted for her corporate portal login. A SAC user is created for Sarah and her user will now appear in System > Users. Sarah is now able to view the story. 


  14. The next step requires you open a new tab in incognito mode and use the validation URL. Make sure any existing Incognito windows signed into SAC are closed before opening the new one. 



    Log onto the tenant and then you should see:

    Close the tab

  15. Go back to the previous window and select validate login:




  16. Review the settings and then click Finish



     

  17. The following success message should appear: 


     

  18. The tile has now been updated. 
  19. You have now completed the bundling exercise. You can now take advantage of the amazing features that IAS brings. Find all the documentation here: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services

 

Quick Q&A

 

Q: I have set up my corporate IDP, but I want to bypass SSO to log into SAC or Datasphere. How do I do that?

A: Use Conditional Authentication in IAS for the application. Create a rule specifically for a email domain or a group to use the Identity Authentication (local IAS user) instead of the corporate IDP.  More details here 

Q: How do I set up multiple Corporate IDP's?

A: Add a second IDP through IAS > Identity Providers > Corporate Identity Providers. After that, in the IAS application, add conditional authentication to support multiple IDP's based on email domain or groups.

Q: Does having multiple Corporate IDPs impact licensing for SAC?

A: No it should not impact licensing as the license thresholds are based on SAC Users that are created in the system. 

Q: How will a greenfield situation work where a tenant is new and has no users

A: The steps for greenfield will nearly be the same. At a high level, you would still go to IDP Admin and trigger the bundling. After the bundling step is done, you can configure the corporate IDP or just choose to leave it IAS as the main identity provider.

entry.title: SAP Hardware : OS from RHEL 8.1 to RHEL 8.8 in the cluster environment in AWS
entry.content:
The purpose of this document is to outline the steps taken to update the OS from RHEL 8.1 to RHEL 8.8 in the cluster environment in AWS  . Detailed steps include the following:

  1. Take an AMI of each AWS instance being upgraded.
  2. SPECIFIC FOR Individual system ‚Äì MAKE SURE TO BACKUP THE FOLLOWING FILE ‚Äì
    1. /lib/ocf/resource.d/heartbeat/< Path for VIP>  
  3. Stop PAS and AAS
    1. sapcontrol -nr 0 -function StopSystem
  4. Stop the app cluster
    1. pcs cluster stop --all
  5. Stop the DB cluster
    1. pcs cluster stop --all
  6. Initiate the OS upgrade on the app cluster ‚Äì both nodes can be done at the same time.
    1. yum --releaserver=8.8 update
  7. Initiate the OS upgrade on the db cluster ‚Äì both nodes can be done at the same time.
    1. yum --releaserver=8.8 update
  8. Update the /etc/yum/vars/releasever from 8.1 to 8.8 on all servers after the upgrade is completed.
    1. vi /etc/yum/vars/releasever
    2. 8.8
    3. wq!
  9. Reboot the app cluster hosts ONCE upgrade is complete on BOTH servers.
  10. Reboot the DB cluster hosts ONCE upgrade is complete on BOTH servers.
  11. USE THIS STEP FOR  CLUSTER ONLY
    1. Once both db and app servers are back online post-upgrade. Stop the cluster on both db and app. You will see the IP resource is failing to start.
      1.       pcs cluster stop ‚Äìall
    2. Update the contents of the /lib/ocf/resource.d/heartbeat/aws-vpc-move-ip file taken in step 2 with what you see in the backup file you have (specifically these parameters found at the top of the file). Stage values shown below (PROD WILL BE DIFFERENT for the first parameter).
      1.       OCF_RESKEY_routing_table_role_default=‚Äùarn:aws:iam::885497102981:role/coreerp-tradenext-ec2-role‚Äù
      2.       OCF_RESKEY_lookup_type_default=‚ÄùNetworkInterfaceId‚Äù
    3. After the file is updated on all nodes, start the cluster and the IP resource should assign properly to each node.
      1.       pcs cluster start --all
    4. Validate the DB cluster and App Cluster start in a proper state. 
      1. pcs status

Cluster Status BEFORE UPDATE -

DB

App

Once the AMI is good and the cluster is stopped, perform the steps below in each server.

pcs cluster stop ‚Äìall

yum --releasever=8.8 update

vi /etc/yum/vars/releasever

8.8

Stop App Cluster

Initiate OS Minor Upgrade -

 yum --releaseserver=8.8 update

 

SAS 01

 

 

 Run the update on Node 2 :

Reboot both servers.  Took - 5 min - App Cluster is good -

 DB CLUSTER ‚Äì Put the cluster in maintenance mode and repeat the steps as in App server .

pcs property set maintenance-mode=true

After OS Update  : Take the cluster out of maintenance mode.

pcs property set maintenance-mode=false

 Testing Cluster to make sure it works prior to OS Upgrade - Must wait for MEM to unload due to defunct WP regarding index server.

Mem Unloading - Node 1

Cluster is communicating -

Stop DB and Reboot OS  respective Hyperscale Console   

 Both Nodes are available after the reboot from AWS console

entry.title: Re: Journal Document upload Error
entry.content:
Hello @JackN11 

Thank you for your message to the community. Let me walk you through it.

The error you experience while maintaining storage category appears because the system cannot find a valid storage category configuration for attachments in your tenant.

You can resolve this by:

Go to your Manage Solution, open the SSCUI for Define Document Types and Storage Categories. Here you must ensure a valid storage category is assigned for the type of attachment you are trying to upload. Manage Documents

Verify your content repository through SAP Document Managment Service. If none is assigned, then that is the cause of the error.

For Journal entry attachments, SAP delivers default storage category. So, check if this is missing in your tenant. If it is, maintain it under the SSCUI mentioned earlier.

Please note, in some tenants, this customizing is restricted. In that case, you must raise an SAP incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and request SAP to activate or assign the missing storage.

The following links will provide more details.

Manage Documents

SAP KBA 2588128

SAP KBA 3404516

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Issues updating journal entry
entry.content:
Hi @JackN11 

The G/L account 10053 is not defined in company code 0D00 means that the account you entered does not exist or is not assigned in the chart of account for the company code you are trying to use.

To resolve that issue, check the following:

  • G/L Account must exist. To confirm, open the Manage G/L Account Master Data app, search for account 100053, if it does not exist then you must create it.
  • If the account exists in the chart of accounts but not for company code 0D00, you must extend it to that company code. Considering you are on the public cloud, you can do this in the manage G/L account master data app.
  • Then make sure the account type and field status are valid for manual postings. If it is a reconciliation account for example for your customers or vendors, you cannot post it directly.

Consult Manage G/L Account Master Data  & Manage Operating G/L Accounts for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Manage Incoming Payment Files will not import valid r...
entry.content:
Hi @P_Quiroz_23 

Thank you for your question.

Please note, when you import BAI files, the system follows a restricted approach because it requires data integrity and consistency for your bank account management reconciliation. If your entry has no present account number in the bank account management, the file you try to upload will be rejected. This is to prevent incorrect processing that could lead to some financial discrepancies.

Currently, SAP does not provide an option for you to import only the valid records and log invalid ones separately in this app.

However, you can consider the following:

  • Request your bank to adjust the BAI file records to only include known account numbers.
  • Alternatively, you can process the BAI files before importing them into SAP. Make sure you separate valid and invalid entries.
  • Make sure you review the error logs that are generated during import to identify and correct wrong entries.
  • Use the manual correction features provided by SAP to handle exception after you have attempted the import.

Consult Payment Rejections & Importing Files Containing Notifications of Rejected Direct Debit Instructions for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Change Language - SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
Hello @Joselubc 

Thank you for your question.

It is important to note that in public cloud modifying or adding national language follows a structured localization approach.  

  • There are currently 34 languages out-of-the-box delivered for around 60 countries by sap. That means for any additional or regional language like the one you seek; you cannot simply change or add it directly as you could in R/3 or on-premise systems.
  • Instead, SAP offers Localization as Self-Service capability. This includes a tool (CLT) which enables you to create or extend local versions to suit your business requirements. Therefore, allowing you to extend existing country localisations or create new local versions.
  • Note that changes must be done in the scope configuration before you can activate it. Direct additional languages outside the one provided by SAP is limited to ensure you maintain consistency, comply with legal requirements and ensures upgradability.

Consult Language Import in SAP S/4HANA,  Determining Display Language & Supported Languages for more details

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud: Professional Service Project Amount...
entry.content:
Hello @BryAguado 

The behaviour you mentioned is correct in S/4HANA Cloud. Please note that credit memos created even with reference to existing posted invoices may not update the project amount if the WBS element linked to the credit memo is included in the work package of your customer project.

The revenue substitution you are seeing is likely due to how your system determines the leading WBS element for revenue posting. In your case, the WBS element to which the credit memo posts are not directly tied to a work package. The mapping and structure of your project might provide answer to the issue.

  • Make sure the WBS elements you reference on the credit memo is part of the work package.
  • Then review your work package definition and make sure it includes all relevant WBS elements for revenue adjustment.
  • Regarding the message in the billing log, it indicated that the system is deriving the revenue posting WBS from a substitution rule or standard logic. Check your project configuration, substitution rules or enhancement logic in the professional services are.
  • You can display, edit and change credit memo requests in the Fiori or manage credit memo request app. This also includes the option to review item references and WBS assignments.

If required, consider creating manual credit memo requests and reference the correct WBS package or reassigning WBS elements within your project.

Consult Customer and Internal Project Management & Entering Customer Invoices and Credit Memos for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: S4 Public Cloud 0L vs 4G configuration
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu 

Consider the following links for that scenario

Foreign Currency Valuation

Advanced Valuation in Financial Accounting

Here are some additions to the customers request/question.

OL is the leading ledger in S/4HANA Cloud. That means all valuations, postings and reporting rely on it. Only on leading ledger is allowed in Public Cloud.

Ledger 4G is the opposite to OL. This means, it is sometimes activated by implementation partners for parallel accounting. This could be for IFRS vs. Local GAAP but is typically used for universal parallel accounting scenarios.

While classic foreign currency valuation is available in some legacy scenarios, for public clouds SAP recommends and delivers the Advanced Foreign Currency Valuation. Once this is activated in a tenant, configurations and posting will be harmonised across ledgers.

So, no you cannot use OL for classic FX and 4G Advanced FX valuation. Considering Foreign currency valuation is a global process, SAP does not allow you split the ledgers.

If the partner has activated 4G then the Advanced FX Valuation is the standard approach to be applied. One consistent FX valuation across all ledgers is the only supported configuration.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Replication from S/4HANA Public Clou...
entry.content:
Hello @FlorisBoon 

Thank you for your question.

Regarding your questions, here are a few facts:

  1. There is no official SAP Note or standard fix that automatically includes the General BP role in DRF payload from S/4HANA Public Cloud. Considering it is a technical role in the backend, it is not released in any API config.
  2. As a workaround on the EWM side, it is possible to implement a BAdI (such as /SCWM/EX_BUPA_INBOUND). This should add the General Role to all incoming Business Partners. This also enriches the payload after receipt and thereby allowing EWM to process the BP correctly even if the General role is missing in the message from S/4
    • If you prefer a custom solution to enhance on the cloud side, note that extension option is limited due to SaaS restrictions.
  3. The scenario you mentioned is not fully covered out-of-the-box for public cloud to decentralized EWM. Custom logic is needed.

I recommend keeping the S/4HANA best practice. You can manage your requirement in EWM.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Accelerating GxP Compliance for SAP Digital Manufacuring in the Public Cloud
entry.content:
The life sciences industry is rapidly adopting SAP‚Äôs public cloud offerings. According to McKinsey, over 80% of the top 30 global pharmaceutical and MedTech companies have adopted cloud solutions across various parts of their operations. Key drivers include lower cost of ownership, scalability, and rapid innovation. Another major influence is the advent of AI and Gen-AI, which McKinsey estimates could unlock $60b - $110b a year in economic value for the industry. However, organizations can only leverage Gen-AI at scale if they operate in the cloud. This adoption also come with a key challenge: How can organizations demonstrate GxP compliance in public clouds, when many controls are managed by SAP?

This article explores the adoption journey for public cloud products, using SAP Digital Manufacturing as an example.

Discover and Prepare

Product assessment for Cloud controls

Traditional on-premises compliance strategies were built around physical infrastructures and static environments. In a modern automated public cloud environment, compliance requirements need adaptation. For example:

  1. Backup and Recovery ‚Äì Life sciences organizations must meet regulatory requirements for backup, including regular snapshots and defined retention schedules. Traditionally, this meant storing daily, weekly, and monthly backups for extended periods. With microservice based environments, older backups lose relevance with every update, limiting restoration usefulness. Organizations should rather adopt a risk-based approach‚Äîaligning backup requirements with Recovery Point Objective (RPO) and Recovery Time Objective (RTO) strategies‚Äîto ensure regulatory adherence and true system recoverability.
  2. Network delivery control: Network and perimeter controls should account for business continuity requirements and the latency challenges in distributed cloud environments. Different components of an application may run across geographically distant regions, impacting performance. When evaluating these factors, SAP published service-level agreements (SLAs) should be considered to get guidance on expected network performance and availability.
  3. Data Residency and Sovereignty: Organizations must ensure not only that their data is hosted in compliant regions, but also that backups and replicated environments adhere to the same regulatory and regional requirements.

Supplier Assessment

Life sciences organizations operating under GxP regulations must ensure quality, compliance, and control, even when using public cloud solutions. Under the shared responsibility model, certain application responsibilities are managed by SAP, while others remain with the life sciences organizations. However, the organizations themselves remain fully accountable to regulatory bodies for demonstrating compliance.

Due to the shared or deleted controls, organizations must qualify SAP as a supplier of GxP-relevant IT solutions. Customers may leverage the available information, questionnaires and 3rd party audit reports such as ISO 9001/27001 and SOC2. Additionally, customers may perform an on-site audit to help bridge gaps in understanding of SAP‚Äôs Quality Management System and other processes.

To facilitate on-site audits‚Äîsuch as with SAP Digital Manufacturing‚Äîcustomers can leverage the SAP Quality Requirement Schedule, which grants limited rights to perform an on-site audit and ensures support when life sciences organizations face regulatory audits.

Explore and Realize

GxP Strategy

Following product and supplier assessment, GxP strategy should be defined to ensure long term viability. Key elements of this strategy can include:

  1. Application Architecture: Evaluate which processes remain on-premises and which move to the cloud. Distributed manufacturing workflows spanning ERP (SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud) and MES (SAP Digital Manufacturing) require balancing data duplication, separation of responsibilities, ease of use, performance, and validation requirements.
  2. Extension: Extensions if required must undergo their own GxP evaluation and IQ/OQ/PQ. Consider the various API‚Äôs and dependencies utilized by the extensions and to adhere to clean core principals to ensure minimal PQ efforts over the extension lifecycle.

Partner selection

Many SAP customers leverage partners to accelerate adoption. Partners solutions are available through various marketplaces such as SAP Store, SAP Business Accelerator Hub and Qualified Partner Packages. For software partners, a supplier assessment is recommended to verify their Quality Management processes and that any integrated solution complies with GxP requirements.

Life sciences organizations also rely on implementation partners for consulting, deployment, and ongoing support activities. These partners should be evaluated on their ability to deliver in a GxP-regulated environment. Partner Blogs highlight nice capabilities, providing insight into compliant implementations.

Deploy and Run

Validation Strategy

Validation requirements for a public cloud are similar to on-premises, however these must be adapted to accommodate the fixed release schedule. Key practices that can assist :

  1. Risk Based on Scope and Usage: Leverage SAP‚Äôs existing documentation, such as Service Catalog, to define the validation scope based on business criticality and GxP impact. Organizations can exclude non-GxP functions to narrow down the scope of validation testing. Validation efforts should prioritize highly critical functionality, while lower critical functions may be tested through smoke test etc.

For regular release cycles the What‚Äôs New Viewer can be used to identify changes in functionality that require assessment on validation requirements. Not all new functionalities must be validated ‚Äì with validation only necessary before the actual usage/adoption of the functionality.

  1. Automation: Automating Computer System Validation (CSV) reduces effort and helps ensure validation is completed on time. SAP Digital Manufacturing provides automation test modules compatible with Tricentis Test Automation (included in Enterprise Support). These automated tests can be leveraged for continuous testing and validation as part of a regression suite.
  2. Leveraging controls from SAP: GAMP5 recommends leveraging supplier testing (post supplier assessment) into verification. Organizations can inherit SAP‚Äôs controls based on the shared responsibility model around topics such as infrastructure, platform, security, data integrity etc.

Gen-AI

Generative AI can further reduce the compliance burden. By combining SAP‚Äôs structured documentation with a customer‚Äôs own documentation, it can generate automated, digitized risk assessments, documentation, and tests‚Äîsignificantly improving both the quality and speed of validation.

Conclusion

Maximizing SAP‚Äôs public cloud potential requires rethinking compliance controls. By adopting a risk-based approach and leveraging various tools provided by SAP, life sciences organizations can meet regulatory requirements while accelerating cloud adoption. This approach ensures compliance, fosters innovation, and builds trust in cloud-based operations.

entry.title: Re: Food for thought: What‚Äôs your favorite holiday/celebration dish?
entry.content:
Reading your story really made me smile because I can completely relate to how food connects us to people and memories. For me, cooking started out of curiosity too, I used to watch my grandmother make simple dishes, and I was always fascinated by how a few ingredients could bring everyone to the table.

During the pandemic, I also found myself spending more time in the kitchen. What surprised me most was how much joy it brought to share those dishes with family. I remember one weekend when I invited my cousins over, and instead of ordering in, we cooked together. Everyone got involved‚Äîone was chopping vegetables, another was mixing sauces, and the kids were shaping patties. It wasn‚Äôt perfect, but it was fun, and by the end we felt closer than ever.

That day also reminded me how much comfort food can bring, whether it‚Äôs a home-cooked meal or even something from outside that becomes part of your story. For example, I still remember the first time I tried Shake Shack with my friends after a long week‚Äîit wasn‚Äôt just about the burgers, but about the laughter, the conversations, and the shared moment.

Food really does have that magic: it nourishes the body, but it also feeds the heart. Thanks for inspiring me to think back on these moments. I‚Äôd love to keep seeing more of your dishes and stories, and maybe I‚Äôll share some of my own experiments here too.

entry.title: Re: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply C...
entry.content:
The ability to perform PGI (Post Goods Issue) in SAP Fiori hinges entirely on the authorization profile, specifically the Business Role and Business Catalog assignments.

So yes, if Sales users lack the catalog that includes the PGI functionality, they won‚Äôt be able to execute PGI‚Äîeven if they can create deliveries. That‚Äôs by design: SAP‚Äôs role-based access ensures users only perform actions aligned with their responsibilities.

  • Who should have access to PGI?

Typically, PGI is granted to roles such as:

  • Warehouse Clerks or Shipping Specialists ‚Äì who physically handle goods and confirm dispatch.

  • Logistics Execution Users ‚Äì responsible for outbound processes.

  • Delivery Processing Roles ‚Äì if PGI is part of their workflow.

These users would be assigned a Business Role that includes the Business Catalog containing the PGI app (e.g., "Outbound Delivery Processing" catalog). You can fine-tune access further using restriction values like shipping point, plant, or delivery type to ensure users only act on relevant data.

If you‚Äôre setting this up, make sure:

  • The correct Fiori app (e.g., Post Goods Issue for Outbound Delivery) is included in the catalog.

  • The catalog is assigned to the right Business Role.

  • The role is assigned to the appropriate Business User.

entry.title: Re: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply C...
entry.content: To enable Post Goods Issue (PGI) functionality in SAP Fiori, you'll need to assign the correct Fiori app and Business Catalog to the relevant Business Role. Here's the precise info you need: üì¶ SAP Fiori App for PGI App Name: Post Goods Issue for Outbound Delivery App ID: F1595 Semantic Object: OutboundDelivery Action: PostGoodsIssue This app allows users to post goods issue for outbound deliveries directly from the Fiori Launchpad. üìö Business Catalog To enable this app, assign the following catalog: Catalog ID: SAP_SD_BC_OUTBOUND_DEL_PROC_MC Catalog Name: Outbound Delivery Processing This catalog includes the PGI app along with other outbound delivery-related apps like Change Outbound Delivery, Display Outbound Delivery, and Create Outbound Delivery. üë§ Who Should Get It? Assign this catalog to roles such as: Shipping Clerk Warehouse Operator Logistics Execution Specialist Sales users typically should not have this catalog unless they are directly involved in logistics execution. This ensures proper segregation of duties and avoids unauthorized PGI actions.

entry.title: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)
entry.content:
Preparing for a SAP ABAP or S/4HANA interview can feel overwhelming. You spend hours revising concepts, yet when the interview starts, the real challenge is remembering which questions are most commonly asked and how to answer them with clarity.

To help you overcome this, I‚Äôve compiled the Top 25 SAP ABAP and S/4HANA Interview Questions for 2025‚Äîbased on real-world interview experiences and what hiring managers actually look for.

This post curates the most common SAP ABAP & S/4HANA interview questions for 2025‚Äîspanning DDIC, ALV, BDC, CDS, AMDP, Open vs Native SQL, ABAP on HANA, Web Dynpro and more. For clear, step-by-step answers, watch the full breakdown here:
üëâ Video: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

üìå Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions (2025)

  1. What is SAP ABAP?
  2. What is the ABAP Data Dictionary (DDIC)?
  3. Difference between transparent tables and pooled/cluster tables
  4. What are SmartForms and their benefits over SAP Scripts?
  5. Difference between function modules and BAPIs
  6. What is BDC (Batch Data Communication)? Methods: recording, session, call transaction
  7. What are modularization techniques in ABAP?
  8. Difference between Classical Reports, Interactive Reports, and ALV Reports
  9. What are field symbols and how are they used?
  10. How do you define and use internal tables?
  11. What are the basic data types in ABAP?
  12. What is ABAP Objects (OOP in ABAP)?
  13. Explain inheritance and polymorphism in ABAP Objects
  14. What is a Lock Object? How is locking handled in ABAP?
  15. Open SQL vs Native SQL ‚Äì differences and use cases
  16. What are RICEFW objects in SAP projects?
  17. Explain CALL TRANSACTION and its use cases
  18. What are CDS Views and their significance in S/4HANA?
  19. What is AMDP (ABAP Managed Database Procedure) and why is it used?
  20. Debugging in ABAP ‚Äì breakpoints, watchpoints, ST22 dumps
  21. What is Web Dynpro for ABAP?
  22. CDS vs AMDP vs Traditional Reports ‚Äì when to use which?
  23. What are the key features of ABAP on HANA?
  24. What tools and T-codes are essential for ABAP development?
  25. What are type groups and their purpose in ABAP?

Why this matters in 2025 (How to Crack SAP ABAP Interview)

SAP technology continues to evolve, especially with ABAP on HANA and S/4HANA migrations. Interviewers are no longer just testing textbook knowledge‚Äîthey want to see if you can connect concepts to real project scenarios. These 25 questions cover exactly that mix of fundamentals + modern ABAP practices.

üìΩÔ∏è For in-depth answers, examples, and explanations, check out the full video:
üëâ Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

üí° Tip: Don‚Äôt just memorize these questions‚Äîtry to explain them in your own words, link them to project experience, and always be ready with a short example. That‚Äôs what makes you stand out in interviews.

entry.title: Re: In the SAP Public Cloud MTO (Make-to-Order) process,...
entry.content:
For information, in Public Cloud, CBTA is the standard item category for MTO (Make‚Äëto‚ÄëOrder) with item category group CB04. CBTA in the delivered scope items is usually set up for order‚Äërelated billing (billing relevance ‚ÄúI‚Äù ‚Äì billing plan) rather than delivery‚Äërelated billing. Because of that, there is no standard copying control entry from delivery type LF / item category CBTA to billing type F2; the system doesn‚Äôt expect you to bill from the delivery for this process. Hence, F2 is not being created in your case.

SAP Note 3269803 referred here, is a configuration content note that delivers missing copying control entries for certain item categories in S/4HANA Cloud. If your tenant is missing the LF ‚Üí F2 copying control for CBTA and you want to enable delivery‚Äërelated billing for it, this note is relevant, but, in Public Cloud, you cannot directly maintain VTFL/VTFA; you need to use the corresponding SSCUI or request SAP to adjust via Expert Configuration. The note itself won‚Äôt ‚Äúswitch‚Äù CBTA from order‚Äërelated to delivery‚Äërelated billing, but you‚Äôd also need to adjust the billing relevance in the item category and align the schedule line category.

If you want delivery‚Äërelated billing for MTO, CBTA‚Äôs billing relevance must be changed from ‚ÄúI‚Äù to ‚ÄúB‚Äù. This is a scope/process change and hence, check if it aligns with your business requirement.

entry.title: Re: S4 Public Cloud 0L vs 4G configuration
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu

Yes, that is correct. If the customer requires Universal Parallel Accounting, then the Ledger 4G must be used. The partner should explain to the customer why 4G is required and that all process will follow the advance valuation framework.

If there is no requirement for Universal Parallel Accounting, then 4G should not be activated. Which means that in that case OL remains the leading ledger and all valuation will run against it.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Restricting User-Level Read and Delete Access - Datas...
entry.content:
Hi, I think that the question is more business user oriented. Not developer.

In DSP the DACs control data, but not objects. Only views support DACs anyway, so you cannot add DACs to a table at all. You also cannot allow/disallow access to specific objects to specific users. This is done space-wide. 

If uploading data into DSP via CSV, you assume a developer is uploading, not a business user. So a developer has full access to the table. 

Separated space for each Conso Unit would be the best approach. Another way would be to create a separate Space for CSVs, then for each Conso Unit one table, however this will not restrict the users to see 'other' tables if the want. 

Maybe the best way is to pre-stage the upload into SharePoint. Create an SFTP Connection from DSP to FTP server and upload the files automatically every night via task chain. 

Martin

entry.title: How to send a message through SAP Event Mesh using Abap code?
entry.content:
Hi,
Below code is trying to send a message through Event Mesh based on the status change of a  Freight Order in SAP TM. I always get HTTP 404 at the end. Can anyone tell me which part of this code is wrong? I need help especially with the URI part.

 

 

 

REPORT zdemo_event_mesh_4.

DATA: lo_oa2c_client TYPE REF TO if_oauth2_client.
DATA(lv_dest_name)    = 'sample_dest_name'.
DATA(lv_auth_profile) = '/IWXBE/MGW_MQTT'.

cl_http_client=>create_by_destination(
  EXPORTING
    destination                = lv_dest_name
  IMPORTING
    client                     = DATA(lo_http_client)
  EXCEPTIONS
    argument_not_found         = 1
    destination_not_found      = 2
    destination_no_authority   = 3
    plugin_not_active          = 4
    internal_error             = 5
    oa2c_set_token_error       = 6
    oa2c_missing_authorization = 7
    oa2c_invalid_config        = 8
    oa2c_invalid_parameters    = 9
    oa2c_invalid_scope         = 10
    oa2c_invalid_grant         = 11
    oa2c_secstore_adm          = 12
    OTHERS                     = 13 ).

IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
  BREAK-POINT.
ENDIF.

lo_http_client->propertytype_logon_popup = if_http_client=>co_disabled.

TRY.
    cl_oauth2_client=>create( EXPORTING i_profile      = CONV #( lv_auth_profile ) i_configuration = 'sample_conf_id'
                              RECEIVING ro_oauth2_client = lo_oa2c_client ).
  CATCH cx_oa2c.
    BREAK-POINT.
ENDTRY.

TRY.
    lo_oa2c_client->set_token( EXPORTING io_http_client = lo_http_client ).
  CATCH cx_oa2c.
    TRY.
        CALL METHOD lo_oa2c_client->execute_cc_flow.
      CATCH cx_oa2c.
        BREAK-POINT.
    ENDTRY.

    TRY.
        lo_oa2c_client->set_token( EXPORTING io_http_client = lo_http_client ).
      CATCH cx_oa2c.
        BREAK-POINT.
    ENDTRY.
ENDTRY.

DATA(ls_payload) = VALUE zmc_s_demo( carrier = 'Demo Carrier'
                                     transportation_mode = '0001'
                                     transportation_order = 'Demo Order'
                                     transportation_order_exec_sts = '07'
                                     transportation_order_type = 'Outbound'
                                     transportation_order_uuid = 'cd88888c-292b-44a8-bb9a-888888888814'
                                     transportation_shipping_type = 'Demo Type'
                                     __before-transportation_order_exec_sts = '04' ).

DATA(lv_payload) = /ui2/cl_json=>serialize( data        = ls_payload
                                            pretty_name = /ui2/cl_json=>pretty_mode-camel_case ).

DATA lv_payload_x TYPE xstring.

CALL FUNCTION 'SCMS_STRING_TO_XSTRING'
  EXPORTING
    text   = lv_payload
  IMPORTING
    buffer = lv_payload_x.

cl_http_utility=>set_request_uri( EXPORTING  request = lo_http_client->request
*                                  uri     = '/messagingrest/v1/queues/Default/D40100EMMulSft/1/Default/D40100EMMulSft/1/FreightOrder/messages/consumption' ).
*                                  uri     = '/messagingrest/v1/queues/sap/s4/beh/FreightOrder/ExecStatusChanged/v1/messages' ).
                                  uri     = '/messagingrest/v1/topics/sap/s4/beh/FreightOrder/ExecStatusChanged/v1/messages' ).
*                                  uri     = 'sap/s4/beh/FreightOrder/ExecStatusChanged/v1' ).
*                                  uri     = 'Default/D40100EMMulSft/1/Default/D40100EMMulSft/1/FreightOrder' ).

lo_http_client->request->set_method( 'POST' ).
lo_http_client->request->set_content_type( 'application/json' ).
lo_http_client->request->set_data( lv_payload_x ).

lo_http_client->send(
    EXCEPTIONS
      http_communication_failure = 1
      http_invalid_state         = 2 ).

lo_http_client->receive(
  EXCEPTIONS
    http_communication_failure = 1
    http_invalid_state         = 2
    http_processing_failed     = 3 ).

DATA lv_response TYPE string.
lv_response = lo_http_client->response->get_cdata( ).

IF lv_response IS NOT INITIAL.
  BREAK-POINT.
ENDIF.

lo_http_client->response->get_status( IMPORTING code = DATA(lv_code) ).

WRITE: lv_code.

entry.title: Re: SAP Community 2024 QA formatting "Increase Indent" do...
